workflow_rationale: This is a new feature implementation adding production-critical security infrastructure. While addressing technical debt, it introduces new functionality (rate limiting middleware, configuration, metrics) rather than refactoring existing code or fixing bugs. The implementation requires architectural decisions around storage backends, configuration patterns, and tiered limit strategies.

phases.description: Install SlowAPI dependency, add rate limit configuration to Settings, initialize limiter in main.py

subtasks.notes: Added slowapi>=0.1.9 dependency and optional redis[hiredis]>=4.5.0 for distributed deployments. Committed as 3388722.

subtasks.description: Add rate limit configuration fields to Settings class in backend/core/config.py
subtasks.notes: Added rate limit configuration fields to Settings class in backend/core/config.py. Created backend package structure (__init__.py files). Uses Pydantic Settings with SettingsConfigDict for env file support. Committed as 59c1f29. Note: Verification command could not be run due to sandbox command restrictions, but code follows spec patterns exactly.

subtasks.description: Initialize SlowAPI limiter in backend/main.py and add global exception handler

phases.name: Auth Endpoint Rate Limiting
phases.description: Apply rate limit decorators to authentication endpoints in backend/api/auth.py

subtasks.description: Apply @limiter.limit() decorators to authentication endpoints with Request parameter

phases.name: Tools Endpoint Rate Limiting
phases.description: Apply execution and read rate limits to tools endpoints in backend/api/tools.py

subtasks.description: Apply execution rate limits (5/minute) to POST /{tool_id}/execute endpoint
Apply read rate limits (100/minute) to GET / and GET /{tool_id} endpoints

phases.name: Metrics and Observability
phases.description: Add rate limit metrics to /api/health endpoint and verify HTTP 429 responses

subtasks.description: Integrate rate limiting metrics into existing /api/health endpoint

verification.note: Response should include rate_limiting section with configuration

subtasks.description: Verify HTTP 429 responses include Retry-After header

verification.instructions: Send 11 requests to /api/auth/aws-credentials, verify 11th returns HTTP 429 with Retry-After header showing seconds to wait

phases.name: Testing and Validation
phases.description: Verify rate limiting behavior, existing tests pass, and graceful degradation

subtasks.description: Run existing test suite to ensure no regressions
Manual testing of rate limit tiers (auth, execution, read)

verification.instructions: Test each tier: (1) Auth endpoints hit limit at 10/min, (2) Execution at 5/min, (3) Read at 100/min. Verify 429 status, Retry-After headers, and app continues serving other requests

subtasks.description: Verify configuration changes apply without code modification

verification.instructions: Change RATE_LIMIT_AUTH_ENDPOINTS in .env from 10/minute to 5/minute, restart server, verify new limit applies

parallel_groups.reason: Both depend only on phase-1-foundation and modify different files (auth.py vs tools.py)

acceptance_criteria: Configuration changes apply via environment variables
No application crashes when limits exceeded

verification_steps.name: Integration Tests - Auth Rate Limit
verification_steps.command: for i in {1..11}; do curl -X POST http://localhost:8500/api/auth/aws-credentials -H 'Content-Type: application/json' -d '{"access_key":"test","secret_key":"test","environment":"com"}'; done

verification_steps.name: Integration Tests - Execution Rate Limit
verification_steps.command: for i in {1..6}; do curl -X POST http://localhost:8500/api/tools/1/execute; done

verification_steps.name: Integration Tests - Read Rate Limit
verification_steps.command: for i in {1..101}; do curl http://localhost:8500/api/tools/; done

verification_steps.name: Health Endpoint Metrics
verification_steps.expected_outcome: Returns rate limiting configuration and status

verification_steps.name: Retry-After Header Verification
verification_steps.expected_outcome: Response includes Retry-After header with seconds value

verification_strategy.reasoning: High-risk security middleware affecting all API endpoints requires comprehensive testing to ensure legitimate traffic isn't blocked while malicious traffic is properly rate limited

checks: Rate limit information visible in OpenAPI documentation
